p: Since glycated plant proteins show high solubility, excellent emulsification activity, and stability (see Section 5.1), as well as antioxidant properties, their use in the encapsulation of bioactive materials has attracted interest. Simultaneous increases in emulsifying properties and antioxidant activity upon glycation were observed for partially hydrolyzed soy protein isolate with maltodextrin [ 146], pea protein isolate with gum arabic [ 179], the soluble fraction of pea protein isolate with dextran [ 184], walnut protein isolate with glucose [ 254], and partially hydrolyzed black bean protein isolate with glucose [ 191]. These findings could be useful in the future development of encapsulation systems for hydrophobic, oxidation-sensitive compounds.
